III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency's program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth was physically assaulted by 3 other youth. The youth
grabbed a broomstick to defend himself.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant contact was attempted via phone on 4/23/2025,
4/29/2025, and 5/5/2025. A return call was not received.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at his temporary crisis
center placement on 5/1/25. Youth A advised he was not going to
talk to the consultant. Youth A declined to discuss or answer any
questions regarding the altercation between himself and other
youth in the named facility, stating “I ain’t no snitch.” Youth A
reported staff did what they were supposed to do to separate the
youth who were engaging in the altercation and declined to
provide further information or details including which staff were
present and which youth were involved and/or present.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/25.
Staff 1 reported he was not present when the altercation first
began but responded to the loud noise resulting from it and came
to assist. Staff 1 could not recall what staff were already in the
room at the time but that there were staff present when he arrived.
Staff 1 reported upon arrival to the lounge he observed Youth A
on his back on the floor and he positioned himself between Youth
A and the youth attempting to hit him, (he believed the youth to be
Youth B). Staff 1 reported he began to provide verbal support to
Youth A saying things such as “it will be okay, you are safe.” Staff
1 reported Youth A was upset as evidenced by crying and saying
Youth B and Youth C had jumped him. Staff 1 reported Youth A
had a dustpan in his hand, and he pushed the handle away, so it
came out of Youth A’s hand. Staff 1 reported other staff (couldn’t
remember who) escorted the other youth (couldn’t remember who)
out of the area and the situation de-escalated. Staff 1 reported
911 was contacted. Staff 1 reported Youth A had history with
Youth C, who attacked him, and the situation could have been
prevented. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B were on
separate floors, but Youth B came down to the same floor to fight
2

with Youth A. Staff 1 did not provide information on how the
situation could have been prevented.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/25.
Staff 2 reported he assisted in separating Youth B and Youth C
from Youth A. Staff 2 reported he did not know what other staff
were doing as he was focused on Youth B. Staff 2 could not recall
who else was involved other than Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C.
Staff 2 reported he was not aware of issues between these youth
prior to this altercation other than occasional bickering between
them, which never resulted in physical altercations. Staff 2
reported he was able to separate Youth B out of the area with
verbal redirection and calming him down. Staff 2 reported he had
no concerns with how the situation was handled by staff as they
all did their part to verbally de-escalate and separate the youth
involved. Staff 2 reported Youth A was offered medical attention
but declined. Staff 2 reported 911 was contacted. Staff 2 denied
knowledge of any injuries.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/25.
Staff 3 reported she was not aware of any issues between Youth
A, Youth B, and Youth C prior to the altercation. Staff 3 reported
Youth A was in the corner of the first floor lounge when she heard
him say “they are going to jump me” at which time she looked over
to see Youth A was on his back holding the dustpan handle with
Youth B and Youth C standing over him. Staff 3 reported she and
Staff 4 were in the first floor lounge when the incident occurred.
Staff 3 reported staff (couldn’t remember who) worked to break up
the altercation by verbally redirecting Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C to separate, physically standing between them and pointing with
their fingers where they wanted them to move away to. Staff 3
denied any restraints were needed to separate the youth. Staff 3
denied anyone was injured other than Staff 4, whose hand was hit
by the dustpan handle when she reached for it to block Youth A
from striking Youth B. Staff 3 reported Youth A stated his head
hurt, however he refused medical attention. Staff 3 reported EMS
and the police arrived at the scene. Staff 3 denied any concerns
with how the matter was handled. Staff 3 reported following the
altercation, the youth involved were kept separated.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/25.
Youth B reported he and Youth C were trying to hit Youth A and
staff (Staff 2 and couldn’t remember what other staff) broke it up.
Youth B reported Youth A hit him with the dustpan. Youth B
reported the only injuries he knew of was Youth A may have hurt
his head or his leg. Youth B reported staff did what they were
supposed to do in separating them and he was not restrained.
Youth B reported he was pulled away from the situation by Staff
3

4’s arm. Youth B denied knowing who else was around. Youth B
reported Staff 2 (Youth B did not recall what other staff) separated
them by telling them to move and getting in between them. Youth
B reported staff were aware he had issues with Youth A before it
happened. Youth B could not recall which staff were aware. Youth
B reported the police and EMS came to the facility and talked to
everyone.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/25.
Youth C reported he and Youth A would get into it a lot, saying
things to each other. Youth C did not know if any staff were aware
of his ongoing conflict with Youth A. Youth C reported he was not
on a separation plan from Youth A. Youth C reported he tried to hit
Youth A and missed. Youth C reported he did not have another
opportunity to hit Youth A because staff (he could not recall which
staff) were in between them. Youth C reported as soon as he and
Youth A, and Youth B got loud, staff (couldn’t remember who)
intervened and separated Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Youth
C denied knowledge of anyone getting hurt. Youth C reported staff
calmed everyone down by telling them to separate and walking
with them away from the situation.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/25.
Staff 4 reported she and Staff 3 were in the first floor lounge and
Staff 4 was working with Youth D at the time of the incident. Staff
4 reported she moved in to assist in de-escalation when she saw
Youth A was on the ground, on his back, in the corner. Staff 4
reported Youth B and Youth C were trying to get to Youth A when
Youth A attempted to hit Youth B with the dustpan. Staff 4
reported she put her arm up to block it and the dustpan hit her in
the arm. Staff 4 stated she was offered medical attention when
EMS came to the scene. Staff 4 denied knowledge of anyone else
being injured. Staff 4 reported everyone was talked to by EMS and
police after the incident. Staff 4 stated the other staff involved
were Staff 2 and Staff 3 and she could not remember who else.
Staff 4 reported that Staff 2 and Staff 3 were assisting in breaking
up the fight. She could not provide specific details on the specific
actions of each staff however did state that they were all trying to
get in between Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C to stop them from
getting to one another. Staff 4 denied knowledge of any
altercations or issues between Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
prior to this incident.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/25.
Youth D reported he observed Youth A holding a dustpan trying to
hit people with it. Youth D was not able to recall who Youth A was
trying to hit stating he and the other youth in the lounge were
escorted out of the area. Youth D denied knowledge of anyone
4

being hurt or what occurred after. Youth D reported staff (couldn’t
remember who) intervened by getting in between the youths who
were fighting so they could not hit each other. Youth D reported he
did not see anyone do anything else. Youth D was not aware of
how the youths involved got along before the incident. Youth D
was not able to recall any staff names, youth names, or what
anyone looked like other than Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed on 5/29/25 via phone. Supervisor
reported she was not present for the start of the incident between
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Supervisor could not recall who
authored the incident report. Supervisor reported hearing the
commotion of yelling from the foyer area (across from the first
floor lounge) at which time she responded by coming over to
assist with de-escalation. Supervisor denied witnessing any
physical restraints taking place or hearing what Youth A, Youth B
and Youth C said to one another. Supervisor reported when she
approached, Youth A was on the ground and other staff were
positioning themselves between Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
so they could not engage further and directing them verbally to
separate. Supervisor reported recalling Staff 1 was present
however could not recall what other staff were there.
Video Reviewed:
• Video footage of 4/21/25, first floor lounge was reviewed on
5/1/25. Video Footage shows partial view of the right corner
of the first-floor lounge, leaving much of the altercation out
of view. A broom being swung can be seen in the bottom
right corner of the frame followed by Youth A coming into
view with his back to the camera walking backwards. Youth
B can be seen charging towards Youth A while Staff 4
moves between them and places her arm out to block the
youth from reaching one another. Staff 4’s right arm makes
contact with Youth B, stopping him from coming forward
and appearing to shove Youth B away from the area. Youth
A is then seen being shoved into the wall by Youth C while
Youth A strikes Youth C in the back with the dustpan.
Youth A drops out of frame. Staff 2 can be seen with both
arms wrapping around Youth C who is bent over, pulling
him backwards in an improper restraint, turning him upright
then leaving view with his arms still around Youth C’s waist.
Staff 3 can be seen in yellow entering the frame behind
Staff 2, reaching her arms towards Youth B in an attempt to
assist however Youth B is moved out of the area by Staff 2
on their own. Staff 1 cannot be seen on camera. Staff 3 is
seen taking the dustpan out of Youth A’s hands and putting
it in the garbage, sliding the garbage can to the right, away
from Youth A and leaning down to tend to Youth A.
5

Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 4/21/25 authored by Supervisor
documents altercation between Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C in which Youth B and Youth A were saying things
to each other such as “what are you looking at” and “who
are you talking to” at which time Youth B and Youth C
walked towards Youth A into the corner of the lounge and
Youth A picked up the broom. The IR documents youth
were separated by staff and staff retrieved the broom from
Youth A. IR documents there were no injuries.
• Critical Incident Response Procedure states staff should
assess the scene to identify and prioritize urgency and
needed services.
• Policy & Procedure for CPI in Residential Programs states
non-violent physical restrictions are only used to protect
client or others from unanticipated or severely aggressive
behavior that places them at serious threat of violence or
injury if no immediate intervention occurs. The steps
leading up to non-violent physical restriction must follow the
teachings and principles of the CPI curriculum.
• Email authored by Chief Administrator states that there
were no documented separation plans in place involving
Youth A, Youth B, or Youth C.
• Email authored by Chief Administrator states Youth A was
not on a 1:1 ratio and that Youth B, and Youth C were on
no special observations at the time of the incident.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as it was consistently reported
in staff and youth interviews that staff intervened quickly when the
altercation began. It was consistently reported staff intervened
using verbal redirection and physically placing themselves
between youth. Although Staff 1 reported there was awareness of
concerns between Youth A and Youth B, there were no
documented separation plans, and no other staff reported being
aware of concerns between the youth involved.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
6

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth B was shoved by Staff 4 during intervention of youth-on-
youth altercation
Investigation Interviews:
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/25.
Youth B reported he was pulled away from the situation by Staff 4.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 4/21/25, first floor lounge was reviewed on
5/1/25. Youth B can be seen charging towards Youth A while Staff
4 moves between them and places her arm out to block the youth
from reaching one another. Staff 4’s right arm makes contact with
Youth B, stops him from coming forward, and then shoves Youth
B away from the area.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 4’s employee file includes 2 employee counseling
forms unrelated to the current investigation. Staff 4
completed Behavioral Management – Restraints & Punitive
Measures training on 3/18/2025.
• Policy & Procedure for CPI in Residential Programs states
non-violent physical restrictions are only used to protect
client or others from unanticipated or severely aggressive
behavior that places them at serious threat of violence or
injury if no immediate intervention occurs. The steps
leading up to non-violent physical restriction must follow the
teachings and principles of the CPI curriculum.
Analysis The facility is found in violation as video footage shows Staff 4
reaches her right arm out, blocks Youth B from engaging in the
altercation, and then shoves Youth B away from the area.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
• The facility should consider adding all aspects of the Rule
158 and its subsections, especially prohibiting the specific
items noted in this rule, into their policies.
• The facility should train/remind staff not to grab youths’
clothing to redirect youth away from a situation.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule R 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth;
Section reduction, prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of
Description restraints.
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth C was improperly restrained by Staff 2
Investigation Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 4/21/25, first floor lounge was reviewed on
5/1/25. Video Footage shows Staff 2 with both arms wrapping
around Youth C (who is bent over), pulling him backwards in an
improper restraint, turning him upright then leaving the camera
view while still holding Youth C around the waist.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 2 does not have any disciplinary actions in his
employee file. Staff 2 completed CPI training on 5/17/25
and Behavioral Management Training on 3/18/25.
• Policy & Procedure for CPI in Residential Programs states
non-violent physical restrictions are only used to protect
client or others from unanticipated or severely aggressive
behavior that places them at serious threat of violence or
injury if no immediate intervention occurs. The steps
leading up to non-violent physical restriction must follow the
teachings and principles of the CPI curriculum. There is no
approved technique that allows for wrapping arms around a
youth and pulling them.
Analysis The facility is found in violation as per video footage reviewed,
Staff 2 did not utilize a proper CPI technique when restraining
Youth C.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR #2025SIC0000366 dated 5/22/25; CAP approved 6/10/25
8

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation A restraint occurred during the incident but was not documented.
Investigation Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 4/21/25, first floor lounge was reviewed on
5/1/25. Video Footage shows Staff 2 with both arms wrapping
around Youth C (who is bent over), pulling him backwards in an
improper restraint, turning him upright then leaving the camera
view while still holding Youth C around the waist.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 4/21/2025 authored by Supervisor
shows box checked to indicate no restraint occurred during
the incident.
• MiSACWIS does not have a restraint incident report
documented for this situation.
• Policy & Procedure for CPI in Residential Programs states
notifications of all behavior interventions must be
documented and entered in MiSACWIS.
Analysis The facility is found in violation as per video reviewed and
documentation reviewed, Staff 2 restrained Youth C and a
restraint report was not completed.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR #2024C0001139SI dated 3/11/24; CAP approved 4/9/24

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable

sir_summary.summary: An altercation occurred at the Wolverine Center where Youth A was assaulted by Youth B and Youth C, leading Youth A to defend himself with a broomstick. Staff intervened but video evidence showed improper restraint by Staff 2 on Youth C and Staff 4 shoving Youth B. The facility was found in compliance regarding sufficiency of staff but violated intervention standards and restraint policies, with multiple repeat violations. Culpability lies with the facility for failing to enforce proper restraint procedures despite prior corrective actions.

sir_violation_level.justification: The substantiated violations involve a youth-on-youth physical assault where a youth was tackled and struck, and staff used unsafe and prohibited physical interventions. Specifically, a staff member improperly restrained a youth (violation of R 400.4159) and another staff member shoved a youth during an intervention (violation of R 400.4158). The incident required police and EMS response. These findings fall under the 'Severe' category due to 'staff-on-youth violence' (shoving and improper restraint) and 'physical assault' (youth-on-youth). The failure to document the restraint (R 400.4163) is a related procedural failure stemming from the serious incident.
